definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Many facts in advertisement field prove that "The fight of advertisement is the fight of mentality".
sentences.chinese: 广告界大量的事实也证明“广告战即心理战”。

sentences.english: Yogi Berra:Baseball is ninety percent mental. The other half is physical.
sentences.chinese: 棒球有百分之九十是心理战，另外一半是靠体能。

sentences.english: She pretends as a princess and gets into a psychological war with SSH over a note (money).
sentences.chinese: 她假扮公主，为了一张纸币与宋承宪展开心理战。

sentences.english: Business negotiation is a difficult process, because it is a psychological warfare.
sentences.chinese: 商务谈判是一个艰难的过程，因为它也是一场心理战。

sentences.english: It could be a psychological ploy , or something worse.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是个心理战术，或者更糟。

sentences.english: This psychological tactics used properly, without the.
sentences.chinese: 这种心理战术运用得当，无不百战百胜。

sentences.english: This is part of a psychological warfare follow-up to the earthquake weapon attack.
sentences.chinese: 这是继地震武器袭击后心理战的一部分。

sentences.english: The forth section is main content of discussion about Pyschological warfare education in National Defence Education of university.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是论述高校国防教育中心理战教育的主要内容。

sentences.english: The government has shot back, accusing its opponents of psychological warfare.
sentences.chinese: 政府已经反击指责其对手的心理战术。

sentences.english: Some people say this kind of psychological tactics is an extremely sharp" soft".
sentences.chinese: 有人戏称这种心理战术是一把锋利无比的“软刀子”。

definition: there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: to spur sb into action by making negative remarks
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
